attributes.action: We the undersigned refuse a second EU referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Leave the European Union
51.9%  17,410,742

Remain a member of the European Union
48.1%  16,141,241

The results show a clear win for a Brexit, but we should also consider the costs of a second referendum.
   
The government has already spent £10 million on leafleting, with the estimated cost of conducting the EU referendum, been put at £142.4 million.
attributes.background:
The country has had a fair democratic vote on the EU, and has decided to "Leave"  with a clear margin of 1269501 votes.  

A second referendum would be damaging to the democracy of Britain. It would also be an  unnecessary cost to the British tax payer.
